javayang@... wrote:
> Howdy folks,
> 
> I have a test method that iteratres through a String array performing
> assert checks.  The problem I have is on the first failure, the tests
> discontinues and the rest of the array is not checked.  This makes
> sense because of the exception that is thrown and handled by JUNIT. 
> Is there a away I can keep the loop running until it finishes all the
> strings.  I can catch the exception but how do I add it to the
> current aggregate test results that JUNIT is keeping track of.  Also,
> is this the best way or proper way to do this?  I don't think it
> makes very much sense to write a test method for each string in the
> arry, it wouldn't be very scalable or dynamic.  Thanks in advance for
> any help or advice. 

The xUnit philosophy is for tests to be focused and that tests either 
pass or fail. There is no "degree of failure". If you have different 
assertions that should evaluate separately from one another, then try 
implementing them as separate tests.
